name: Buuz
short_description: Steamed to perfection, these traditional Mongolian dumplings are filled with savory beef or mutton, seasoned with onions and fresh herbs. A beloved comfort food, Buuz reflects Mongolia’s rich culinary heritage.

name: Borts
short_description: A cherished Mongolian tradition, borts features dried meat from cows, goats, or camels, expertly cut and air-dried to preserve flavor. Its robust, savory taste captures the spirit of resilient winters.

name: Bansh
short_description: Mongolian bansh are succulent dumplings filled with a savory mix of beef and mutton, infused with onion and garlic. Boiled to perfection, they offer a warm, hearty taste of nomadic tradition.

name: Boodog
short_description: A Mongolian delicacy, boodog showcases whole goat roasted with hot stones, infusing tender meat with rich flavors of potatoes and onions. It’s a communal feast that embodies nomadic tradition.

name: Bantan
short_description: A beloved Mongolian remedy for hangovers, this hearty soup combines tender lamb, fresh spring onions, and savory dough crumbs. Each spoonful warms the soul with rich flavors and comforting textures.

name: Tsuivan
short_description: Handmade noodles mingle with tender mutton and vibrant vegetables in Tsuivan, a cherished Mongolian staple. Steamed to perfection, each bite bursts with rich flavors and hearty comfort.

name: Khuushuur
short_description: Savory and satisfying, these deep-fried pastries burst with the rich flavors of ground mutton and onions, embodying the heart of Mongolian cuisine. Perfect for a hearty snack or meal on the go!

name: Khorkhog
short_description: Traditional to Mongolia, Khorkhog features tender meat slow-cooked in large milk jugs with heated stones, infusing it with a smoky, savory flavor. The steam creates a succulent, aromatic delight.

name: Guriltai shul
short_description: Originating from Mongolia, this hearty noodle soup features tender beef or mutton simmered with onions and carrots in a rich broth, served over flat noodles for a comforting, flavorful experience.

name: Boortsog
short_description: Golden and fluffy, these traditional Mongolian fried bread rolls offer a delightful crunch and a soft, buttery interior. Perfectly paired with tea or enjoyed on their own, they embody the warmth of Mongolian hospitality.

name: Budaatai huurga
short_description: Originating from Mongolia, this hearty stir-fry combines fragrant rice with tender beef or lamb, vibrant cabbage, and a medley of vegetables, all brought together with rich eggs for a satisfying meal.

name: Eezgii
short_description: Originating from Mongolia, Eezgii features rich, creamy flavors as milk, yogurt, and kefir are expertly cooked until all liquids evaporate, creating a delightful, dense cheese enjoyed in traditional feasts.

name: Chanasan makh
short_description: Originating from Mongolia, tender chunks of mutton simmer with bones, creating a rich, savory flavor that reflects the nomadic lifestyle. Simple yet hearty, it’s a true taste of tradition.
